articles.title: World Brain Tumour Day 2025: Early Diagnosis And Awareness Key To Brain Health For All Ages
articles.description: World Brain Tumour Day 2025 serves as a reminder of the importance of early detection and timely medical intervention. Public education on the warning signs and advancements in neuro-oncology is vital to improve patient outcomes. Brain health matters at every stage of life, and with awareness and medical innovation, we can offer hope and healing to those affected.
articles.content: Every year, June 8th is observed as World Brain Tumour Day, a global initiative to raise awareness about brain tumours, their symptoms, treatment, and the importance of early detection. The theme for 2025, "Brain Health for All Ages," underscores the... [3143 chars]

articles.description: The US president says he's sending in 2,000 troops to deal with unrest over raids on undocumented migrants.

articles.title: 37K police officers to secure opening of classes
articles.description: MANILA, Philippines — At least 37,000 police forces are ready to secure students as classes open on June 16, 2025, the Philippine National Police (PNP) said Sunday.
articles.content:
MANILA, Philippines — At least 37,000 police forces are ready to secure students as classes open on June 16, 2025, the Philippine National Police (PNP) said Sunday.

articles.title: Got a cough coming on? Don’t soldier on. For heaven’s sake, march homewards
articles.description: Based on the cavalier public behaviour I’ve witnessed recently, I fear we’ve forgotten the hard-won lessons of COVID.
articles.content:
The full-body cough is back. You may remember them from pre-COVID days, when people with bad coughs or a cold often felt free to move at large without embarrassment or mask.
